column1: Table D3.08.18: Experiences of discrimination by remoteness, Indigenous Australians aged 15 and over, 2018–19
Whether had unfair experience in the last 12 months because Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander(a)
Has not had an unfair experience
Had unfair experience
Types of experiences of unfair treatment in the last 12 months because Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander
Called names, teased or sworn at
Heard racial comments or jokes
Ignored or served last while accessing services or buying something
Not trusted
Unfairly arrested or charged
Told are less intelligent
Left out, refused entry or told don’t belong
Spat at or had something thrown at
Any other experience that was unfair
Whether avoided situations in the past 12 months due to past unfair treatment
Avoided situations due to past unfair treatment
Did not avoid situations due to past unfair treatment
Types of situations avoided due to past unfair treatment
Applying for work, or going to a job
School, university, training course or other educational setting
Doing any sporting, recreational or leisure activities
The police, security people, lawyers or in a court of law
Doctors, nurses or other staff at hospitals or doctor’s surgeries
When accessing government services
Seeking any other services
Members of the public
Other situations
Didn't avoid any situation

† Estimate has a relative standard error between 25% and 50% and should be used with caution.
‡ Estimate has a relative standard error greater than 50% and is considered too unreliable for general use.
(a) Person present at interview and responding for self. Excludes 'does not know if had unfair treatment'.
(b) Person present at interview and responding for self.
(c) Sum of components may be more than total as people may have reported more than 1 type of situation avoided.
Source: AIHW and ABS analysis of National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Health Survey 2018–19.
